00037 #include <stdio.h>
00038 #include <unistd.h>
00039 #include <string.h>
00040 #include <assert.h>
00041 
00042 #include <fc.h>
00043 
00044 
00045 #include "lib_skeleton.h"
00046 
00047 
00048 
00049 
00050 
00051 typedef struct {
00052   char *file;
00053   char *mesh;
00054   char *displacement;
00055   char *info;
00056 } default_t;
00057 
00058 
00059 default_t defaults[] = {
00060   { "/datasets/fe/ballsmash1.e",                   "Material_ID_3",  NULL,           "Ballsmash"},
00061   { "/datasets/fe/ballsmash1.e",                   "Material_ID_3",  "displacement", "Ballsmash w/ displacement"},
00062   { "/datasets/fe/wobble_c.e",                     "part_1",         NULL,           "Wobble"},
00063   { "/datasets/fe/wobble_c.e",                     "part_1",         "displacement", "Wobble w/ displacement"},
00064   { "/datasets/fe/helium_1.50_2.11.e",             "block_1",        NULL,           "Helium"},
00065   { "/datasets/fe/bookshelf/bookshelf_hole_a.e",   "block_15",       NULL,           "Bookshelf: hole at A"},
00066   { "/datasets/fe/bookshelf/bookshelf_hole_cba.e", "block_19",       NULL,           "Bookshelf: hole at A,B,C"},
00067   { NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL}
00068 };
00069 
00070 
00071 //=============================================================================
00072 static void dumpHelp(void){
00073   int i;
00074   printf("Generate Tree: a simple tool for extracting a tree representation from a mesh\n"
00075          "  This tool takes an input file, generates a spanning-tree structure for a specified\n"
00076          "  mesh, and then saves the mesh to a file. This representation may provide a more\n"
00077          "  convenient way to examine and compare one or more meshes.\n"
00078          "\n"
00079       "Usage: generate_tree [options] input_file1\n"
00080       "  -m mesh_name[step]              (can be appended with displacement step, like block_1[2])\n"
00081       " [-d displacement_variable_name ] (does combinding on _x,_y,_z and defaults to 'displacement')\n"
00082       " [-o output_file ]                output file to generate (default=result_tree.e)\n"
00083       "  -v                              display warning messages\n"
00084       "  -V                              display log messages\n"
00085       "  -S                              Silent operation: don't print info\n"
00086       "  -h                              this help screen\n"
00087       "  -i ##                           Use the following built-in input files:\n");
00088 
00089   for(i=0; defaults[i].file; i++)
00090     printf("     %d : %s\n", i, defaults[i].info);
00091 
00092   exit(0);
00093 }
00094 //=============================================================================
00095 static int getIndexAndTruncateName(char *name){
00096   char *c;
00097   c=name;
00098   while(*c!='\0') {
00099     if(*c=='['){
00100       *c='\0';
00101       c++;
00102       return atoi(c);
00103     }
00104     c++;
00105   }
00106   return -1; //No index, assume initial geometry
00107 }
00108 //=============================================================================
00109 static void checkArgs(int argc, char **argv,
00110                 FC_VerbosityLevel   *verbose_level,
00111                 char                **file_in_name,
00112                 char                **file_out_name,
00113                 char                **mesh1_name,
00114                 char                **displacement1_name,
00115                 int                  *step1){
00116   
00117   int ich, id, i;
00118 
00119   if(argc<2) dumpHelp();
00120 
00121   *file_in_name = *file_out_name = *mesh1_name = *displacement1_name = NULL;
00122   *step1 = -1; //Initial location
00123   _skeleton_dbg=1; //Default to printing info
00124 
00125   while( (ich = getopt(argc, argv, "s:d:m:o:d:i:SvVh")) != EOF){
00126     switch(ich){
00127     case 'v':                          *verbose_level      = FC_WARNING_MESSAGES; break;
00128     case 'V':                          *verbose_level      = FC_LOG_MESSAGES;     break;
00129     case 'S':                          _skeleton_dbg       = 0;                   break;
00130     case 's':                          *step1              = atoi(optarg);        break;
00131     case 'd': if(!*displacement1_name) *displacement1_name = strdup(optarg);      break;
00132     case 'm': if(!*mesh1_name)         *mesh1_name         = strdup(optarg);      break;
00133     case 'o': if(!*file_out_name)      *file_out_name      = strdup(optarg);      break;
00134 
00135     case 'i': //Use one of the built-in cases
00136       id = atoi(optarg);
00137       for(i=0; (i<id) && (defaults[i].file); i++);
00138       if((id<0)||(!defaults[i].file)){
00139      printf("Default id (%d) out of range?\n", id);
00140      dumpHelp();
00141      exit(0);
00142       }
00143       *file_in_name       = strdup(defaults[i].file);
00144       *mesh1_name         = strdup(defaults[i].mesh);
00145       *displacement1_name = (defaults[i].displacement) ? defaults[i].displacement : NULL;
00146       break;
00147 
00148     case 'h': 
00149     default: 
00150       dumpHelp(); break;
00151     }
00152   }
00153 
00154   //Grab the input filename or die
00155   if(optind<argc)
00156     *file_in_name = strdup(argv[optind++]);
00157 
00158   if(!*file_out_name)
00159     *file_out_name = strdup("result_tree.e");
00160 
00161   if((!*file_in_name)||(!*mesh1_name)){
00162     printf("Error: not all required input fields defined\n");
00163     dumpHelp();
00164   }
00165 
00166   //See if there's a timestep index in mesh names (ie, block_1[3])
00167   *step1 = getIndexAndTruncateName(*mesh1_name);
00168 
00169   //Assign the default displacement name
00170   if((*step1>=0)&&(!*displacement1_name)) *displacement1_name = strdup("displacement");
00171 
00172   return;
00173 }
00174 //=============================================================================
00175 // Get a single mesh or die trying
00176 static FC_ReturnCode getMeshByNameOrDie(FC_Dataset ds, char *mesh_name, FC_Mesh *m){
00177 
00178   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00179   FC_Mesh *meshes;
00180   int numMeshes;
00181 
00182   rc = fc_getMeshByName(ds, mesh_name, &numMeshes, &meshes);
00183   fc_exitIfError(rc);
00184   
00185   if(numMeshes!=1)
00186     emsg("Found %d meshes named %s", numMeshes, mesh_name);
00187 
00188   *m = meshes[0];
00189   FREE(meshes);
00190   return FC_SUCCESS;
00191 
00192 }
00193 
00194 
00195 
00196 //=============================================================================
00197 int main(int argc, char **argv){
00198 
00199   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00200   FC_VerbosityLevel verbose_level = FC_WARNING_MESSAGES;
00201   
00202   char *file_in_name, *file_out_name, *mesh1_name, *displacement1_name;
00203   
00204   FC_Dataset ds1;
00205   FC_Mesh    m1;
00206   int        step1;
00207   spanning_tree_t *tree1, *tree2;
00208  
00209   tree1 = tree2 = NULL;
00210 
00211 
00212   //Look at args user gave us
00213   checkArgs(argc, argv, 
00214          &verbose_level, 
00215          &file_in_name, &file_out_name,
00216          &mesh1_name, &displacement1_name, &step1);
00217 
00218 
00219 
00220  
00221   //Open up the library
00222   rc = fc_setLibraryVerbosity(verbose_level);         fc_exitIfError(rc);
00223   rc = fc_initLibrary();                              fc_exitIfError(rc);
00224 
00225   //Pass back info to user
00226   info("generate_tree is running with\n"
00227        "\tInput File   = '%s'\n"
00228        "\tMesh Name    = '%s'\n"
00229        "\tDisplacement = '%s'\n"
00230        "\tStep         = %d\n"
00231        "\tOutput File  = '%s'",
00232        file_in_name, mesh1_name,
00233        displacement1_name, step1,
00234        file_out_name);
00235 
00236   //Load the mesh
00237   rc = fc_loadDataset(file_in_name, &ds1);            fc_exitIfError(rc);
00238   rc = getMeshByNameOrDie(ds1, mesh1_name, &m1);      fc_exitIfError(rc);
00239 
00240   //Build a spanning tree for it
00241   info("Building a spanning tree");
00242   rc = fc_makeSpanningTree(m1, -1,&tree1 );           fc_exitIfError(rc);
00243  
00244 
00245   //Save the tree to its own file
00246   rc = fc_saveSkeleton(*tree1, displacement1_name, 
00247                  file_out_name);                fc_exitIfError(rc);
00248 
00249 
00250 
00251 
00252   info("Done"); 
00253 
00254 
00255 
00256   return 0;
00257 }
